messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Rat Park Study Psychologist Interview
messages.msgSnippet: -=- There was no link to the interview in your message.-=- It would ve been the same link as the original post.  At the bottom of any e-mail is a link that
messages.messageBody:
-=-
There was no link to the interview in your message.-=-

It would've been the same link as the original post. At the bottom of any e-mail is a link that says "messages in this topic."
And those interviews were only free for a very short while, so there's no advantage to bringing the link now.

For those reading on the web, if you change the sort from "individual message" to "topics," you can see whatever's being referred to within a thread.

I'm okay not to discuss those. :-) The note that there were free interviews was fine. :-)

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Rat Park Study Psychologist Interview
messages.msgSnippet: ... There was no link to the interview in your message. I am familiar with Hold on to Your Kids - how do you think his unique perspective fits in with
messages.messageBody:
> There is also an interview w/ Gabor Mate (which will be available for free until 6pm on Wed.) He has a unique perspective on ADHD and co-authored the book, "Hold on to your Kids."

There was no link to the interview in your message.

I am familiar with "Hold on to Your Kids" - how do you think his unique perspective fits in with radical unschooling (if indeed you think so)?
>
> I find his perspective lends itself to understanding how the relationship between parent/child can be healing or harmful.
>
Can you quote Dr. Mate on the subject? We could then discuss it in more detail.

Robin B.

messages.subject: Re: Rat Park Study Psychologist Interview
messages.msgSnippet: There is also an interview w/ Gabor Mate (which will be available for free until 6pm on Wed.)  He has a unique perspective on ADHD and co-authored the book,
messages.messageBody:
There is also an interview w/ Gabor Mate (which will be available for free until 6pm on Wed.) He has a unique perspective on ADHD and co-authored the book, "Hold on to your Kids."

I find his perspective lends itself to understanding how the relationship between parent/child can be healing or harmful.

messages.subject: Rat Park Study Psychologist Interview
messages.msgSnippet: Here s an interview with Bruce Alexander, a psychologist who is most well known for his work on the Rat Park study.  It will be streaming for FREE for a few
messages.messageBody:
Here's an interview with Bruce Alexander, a psychologist who is most well known for his work on the Rat Park study. It will be streaming for FREE for a few more hours.

http://www.entheos.com/Recovery2point0/Play
